column1: 5.2.6	  Summary of evidence and guidelines for staging in muscle-invasive bladder cancer
Imaging as part of staging in muscle-invasive bladder cancer (MIBC) provides information about   prognosis and assists in selection of the most appropriate treatment.
The diagnosis of upper tract UC depends on CT urography and, if needed, ureteroscopy.
In local staging, MRI is superior to CT in terms of differentiating T1 from T2 disease.
Bone scintigraphy has limited value in the staging of invasive BC.
FDG-PET/CT can provide additional information to guide treatment.
